alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clermont; Clinton; Highland; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN CLERMONT, NORTHWESTERN BROWN, SOUTHEASTERN WARREN, SOUTHWESTERN CLINTON AND SOUTHWESTERN HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 715 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Blanchester, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Blanchester, Lynchburg, Russell, Woodville, Newtonsville, Fayetteville, Midland, St. Martin, Chasetown, Danville in Highland County, Westboro, Edenton and Lake Lorelei. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
